thread.title_full: Briefly: Prescott Swim Team sets records

title: Briefly: Prescott Swim Team sets records
text: Briefly: Prescott Swim Team sets records Courtesy photo Members of the Prescott Swim Team. The Daily Courier LOCAL SWIMMINGPRESCOTT SWIM TEAM hosted its 2015 Lou Silverstein Memorial Pumpkin Fest meet Oct. 10 and 11 at Yavapai College, where 17 new Pumpkin Fest records were set. Harris Temple, in the 13-14 age group, established eight of the 17 records - in the 50-yard freestyle, 100 free, 50 backstroke, 50 breaststroke, 100 breaststroke, 50 fly, 100 fly and 100 individual medley. Temple's time of 52.38 seconds in the 100 freestyle stood out. John Kaine, in the 15-19 age group, set six records - in the 200 free, 100 back, 50 breast, 50 fly, 100 fly, and 200 IM. Johnny Dyer, in the 15-19 age group, set three records, in the 50 free, 100 free and 200 back.Individual first-place finishers in each age group were as follows. ... 8 & Under: Heath Tinsley (25-yard free, 25 breast, 200 free, 50 back). 11 & 12: Cheyla Daverman (100 free, 50 free, 50 breast); Callie Oryall (50 back).  13 & 14: Josh Baillie (200 breast); Kara Byram (50 fly, 50 back); Harris Temple (50 fly, 100 free, 100 breast, 50 free, 50 back, 100 fly, 50 breast). 15 to 19: Cole Byram (100 breast); Johnny Dyer (200 back, 100 free, 50 free, 100 IM); John Kaine (50 fly, 200 IM, 200 freestyle, 100 fly, 100 back, 50 breast).Prescott Swim Team also won the 400 medley relay, 200 medley relay, 200 free and 400 free. The team consisted of Kara Byram, Josh Baillie, Harris Temple and Callie Oryall.Prescott Swim Team will host its next home meet, the Prescott Plunge, Jan. 8-10, 2016. All of the squad's meets are open to the public. LOCAL RUNNINGTHE BACK OF THE PACK running group is starting its next training session at 10 a.m. Oct. 24, on the outdoor track at the Prescott YMCA . Back of the Pack offers a non-competitive running group that combines 50 years of running experience and more than 50 completed half-marathons. The group encourages runners to train during a 12-week session to complete the 'Rock & Roll' 5K, 10K or half-marathon Jan. 16 and 17, 2016, in Phoenix. A training fee of $70 covers individualized training plans, group support, race day prep and support, weekly emails, and fun! For more information, call Lynn at 802-688-4511 or Patrice at 928-308-2705, or send an email to backofthepack@gmail.com. Like the group on Facebook at: www.facebook.com/backofthepackrunningclub. GOLFTHE ANTELOPE HILLS MEN'S GOLF CLUB is announcing its membership drive to be effective Oct. 15, which will include all of 2016. The $80 annual fee ($60 senior-80 years old-plus) also covers membership into Arizona Golf Association, one free round of golf with cart, a 30-minute lesson with a golf pro, and being a guest with their spouse/significant other at the Club's Appreciation Dinner Oct. 15. The Men's Club plays a variety of formats every Monday and Wednesday at Antelope Hills Golf Course in Prescott, with an away special event tournament played once a month. The Club is also noted for its partnership with PASS via the fundraiser associated with the Leprechaun Charity Open Golf Tournament. Membership applications may be obtained at Antelope Hills Golf Course, online at ahmgc.com, or by calling 928-499-7788. YOUTH SOCCERATTENTION YOUTH SOCCER PLAYERS in the tri-city area. Yavapai Soccer Club needs select soccer players for its Boys U-14 (02) and U-13 (03) age groups. Also, the U-11 boys request a response from boys who may be interested in playing goalkeeper. If interested, contact via email: U-14 (gittinsent@cableone.net); U-13 (soccersteve68@gmail.com) and U-11 (JuanMontoya39@HSN.com) for information. LOCAL YOUTH SOFTBALLBATBUSTERS FASTPITCH SOFTBALL'S 14U team will be holding open tryouts for its 2016 season. Batbusters coach James Schmidt said it's a highly competitive team with great coaches who have great knowledge of the game. "We focus on fundamentals, conditioning, (and) mental preparation in a competitive environment," he added. The squad's season runs from January through November. Tryouts will go from 9 to 10:30 a.m. Oct. 10 and Oct. 17 at Bill Valley Upper Field next to Yavapai College in Prescott. The Batbusters were 2014 Arizona Amateur Softball Association Class B State Champions. They have also qualified for the 2016 Nationals. For more information, call Schmidt at 928-830-5486. YOUTH BASEBALL ACADEMYHITTING COACH Rob Chriss is offering what he's calling the Process Driven Baseball Academy to tri-city area players ages 9-12. The academy will take place from Sept. 14 through Nov. 16 at Ziegler Field, 1200 Commerce Drive, in Prescott. Sessions will include instruction in mental approach, dynamics of the game, throwing, fielding, base running, hitting, infielding and outfielding. The 10-week program will conduct sessions from 6:30-8 p.m. every Monday during those two months. One day of camp costs $55, or $425 for the entire 10-week session. To register, call Chriss at 928-308-5822 or email him at: robertmchriss@yahoo.com.
